resources.string: •Ten cards are dealt to each player, and five cards are dealt to the "kitty."\n•The bid minimum is 100 and proceeds clockwise where each player may pass or bid. \n•The winner of bidding chooses trump and gets the kitty. The winner can then discard five cards to place back in the kitty. They then get to choose a trump color for the game.

•This is a team game. Partners are across from each other on the game board.
•The objective is to be the first team to reach a certain number of points (this can be changed in Settings)
•Once trump is chosen, cards are played in a clockwise fashion. Players must follow the lead suit if they have it, otherwise they can play any card. Every time all four players play, the trick is taken and points are added. A trump card beats any non-trump card, and a non-suit card can't take the trick. The player that took the trick leads off the next round. This continues for ten tricks, until the cards are dealt again. Gameplay continues until the specified winning number of points is reached. 
•For example, in the image below, you are partners with player 2, and players 1 and 3 are partners. The winning card will take the points of the trick.

A team scores by capturing tricks with point cards, weighted as follows:
•The Rook is 20 points
•Every 1 is 15 points
•Every 10 and 14 are 10 points 
•Every 5 is 5 points
The team that captures the last trick also counts the kitty in the point total.
The team that won the most tricks adds an additional 20 points. 
If a team won the bid and did not meet their bid, they are set back by the number of points their bid was. If a team did not win the bid, they count the number of points they made. 
For example, in the image above, the 1 card will take the trick as it is the highest scoring card.
Click a card to discard it! You can only choose five.
